story_arc: promise → course → data-staircase → pro/con → verdict → alternatives

primary_trope.name: tier_reveal
primary_trope.hook_text: 328 races. 14 dimensions. Where does Sasquatch Duro land?
primary_trope.mechanism: Countdown / ranking — inherent escalation and social comparison.

beats.label: HOOK + PROMISE
beats.narration: Should you race Sasquatch Duro? I rated 328 gravel races on 14 dimensions. Sasquatch Duro scored 56 out of 100. Solid tier. Here's what that actually means for your season.
beats.editing_note: STATE THE PREMISE IN 8 SECONDS. Clear value prop: 'I rated 328 races. Here's where this one lands.' This is the 8-second decision window. Viewers who stay past 15s are 58% more likely to finish.
beats.psych_mechanism: Curiosity gap (specific) + IKEA effect (viewer predicts the tier before reveal).

beats.label: THE COURSE
beats.narration: Sasquatch Duro. Carlton, Oregon. 62 mi. Mountain gravel with significant climbing through Coast Range forests.
beats.editing_note: Let the course breathe. Show the route map, then cut to terrain-specific B-roll. This is the SETUP phase — grounding the viewer before the data analysis. Pacing: 25-40 sec cuts.

beats.label: THE SCORES — Top 8
beats.narration: Fourteen dimensions. Here's where it lands. Elevation. 4 out of 5. Mountain passes on the menu. The 62-mile course delivers 5,000 feet through rolling wine country terrain described as 'mellow climbs and fun descents. Logistics. 3 out of 5. Adequate. The word was invented for this. Packet pickup runs Friday 3-6pm at Carlton City Hall plus Saturday morning at race start. Length. 3 out of 5. The Goldilocks zone of suffering. Adam Stone notes the 40-mile short course 'is not chump change' with nearly 3,000 feet of climbing. Technicality. 3 out of 5. The course bites if you stop paying attention. Described as '62% gravel' with surfaces from 'smooth gravel to rugged sections' through vineyards and forests. Adventure. 3 out of 5. Adventure factor is real. The route travels through 'rolling vineyards, lush forests, serene farmland' with a 2. Race Quality. 3 out of 5. Solid production value. Three aid stations at miles 18, 30, and 46 provide adequate support with PB&J, cookies, and Hammer Nutrition products. Experience. 3 out of 5. The experience justifies the entry fee. Live music runs 12:00-3:30pm in Ladd Park with awards at 2pm and 2:45pm for short and long courses. Community. 3 out of 5. Genuine community feel. People stick around. Dan Shryock notes the event attracts 'both competitive bike racers and casual riders who are more interested in the experience than speed.
beats.editing_note: PROGRESSIVE RHYTHM: start tight (15-20 sec per dimension), slow down for the most interesting scores (30-40 sec). Each score: number appears, brief pause, explanation. Avatar reacts to extreme scores (5/5 = chef_kiss, 1/5 = facepalm). RE-ENGAGEMENT at 3:00 mark: insert a surprising score reveal or a meme reaction to break the pattern.

meme_insert.suggested_clip: avatar reaction to most extreme score

beats.label: THE SCORES — Also Scored
beats.narration: The rest, in rapid succession. Value. 3 out of 5. Fair value. You get what you pay for. Expenses. 3 out of 5. Mid-range expenses. Budget a proper race weekend. Climate. 2 out of 5. Weather cooperates more often than not. Altitude. 2 out of 5. Mild elevation. Most riders won't notice. Prestige. 2 out of 5. Known in certain circles. Niche following. Field Depth. 2 out of 5. Small but scrappy field.
beats.editing_note: FAST PACING — 7 seconds per dimension. Quick-fire energy change from the deep analysis above. This is a PATTERN INTERRUPT through pacing shift.

beats.label: STRENGTHS
beats.narration: Where Sasquatch Duro earns its score.
beats.visual: Strengths list overlay with positive visual treatment
beats.editing_note: Warm energy. Each strength gets its own card. Avatar genuinely positive.

beats.label: WEAKNESSES
beats.visual: Weaknesses list with warning visual treatment
beats.editing_note: MIDPOINT RE-ENGAGEMENT. This is ~55% through. Open with burst sequence (quick cuts, warning sounds). Then deliver weaknesses honestly. Preview what's coming: 'Now, should you actually do this race?' [RIFF HERE] at the transition.

weaknesses: Rain is a concern in Oregon

beats.label: LOGISTICS
beats.narration: Travel, lodging, and the unsexy details.
beats.editing_note: Utility section. Lower energy, practical value. Hybrid Tempo: alternate fast logistics items (10-15 sec) with slow map visuals (30 sec).

logistics: Lodging: Carlton has wine country lodging. Small town with good options. Portland has more.

beats.label: VERDICT
beats.narration: Verdict: Coast Range Mountain Challenge. If you're in Oregon or the Pacific Northwest and want a mountain gravel challenge. yes, it's a well-organized event with genuine climbing. If you're traveling from far away. there are more prestigious mountain events elsewhere.
beats.editing_note: CLOSE THE MAIN LOOP. 0.5s silence before verdict. Tier badge slams in. Avatar delivers final take. DO NOT signal 'wrapping up' — maintain energy.

beats.label: ALTERNATIVES
beats.narration: If Sasquatch Duro isn't quite right for you. For better Oregon events: Oregon Trail Gravel Grinder. For similar regional mountain vibes: other Pacific Northwest mountain events.
beats.editing_note: Bonus value — viewers who reach this point are highly engaged. Cross-reference other videos/races.

beats.label: CTA
beats.narration: Full breakdown on the site. Fourteen scored dimensions. Free race prep kit. Link in the description.
beats.editing_note: End ABRUPTLY after CTA. No 'thanks for watching' wind-down.
beats.engagement_question: Have you raced Sasquatch Duro? Did we get the score right? Drop it in the comments.

meme_inserts.suggested_clip: avatar reaction to most extreme score

thumbnail_prompt: South Park style flat cutout character, dramatic reveal pose, tier badge prominent, 'Sasquatch Duro' bold text, tier badge 'SOLID', high contrast red/yellow/white, cycling gear, handlebar mustache --ar 16:9 --cref [CHARACTER_URL]

cross_platform_notes.youtube: Primary platform. SEO-optimize title for '[Race Name] review'.
cross_platform_notes.extract_shorts: Pull 3-5 Shorts: hook, biggest surprise score, verdict.
cross_platform_notes.blog: Cross-reference the race profile page for search traffic.
